comment deletion**Time Spent**: 30 min#### Fixed Comment Addition Bug**Activity**: Resolved issue where comments weren't added on first attempt- **Problem**: Comments not added due to async React state updates- **Solution**:   - Updated `allComments` useMemo to depend on `interactions`  - Modified `addComment` function to accept text as parameter  - Ensured immediate comment display after addition**Time Spent**: 45 min#### Comment Type Separation**Activity**: Implemented two distinct comment types- **Video Comments**: Comments from Current Segment input appear on video only- **Section Comments**: Comments from Comments Section appear in section only- **Implementation**:  - Added `displayOnVideo` field for type distinction  - Created separate functions: `addComment` and `addSectionComment`  - Updated filtering logic in both components**Time Spent**: 1 hour#### Fixed Comments Appearing on All Videos**Activity**: Resolved issue where comments appeared on wrong videos- **Problem**: Comments from one video appearing on all videos- **Solution**:  - Updated loading logic to use only `persistedInteractions` for current `assetId`  - Added `loadedAssetIdRef` to track loaded assetId  - Separated loading and synchronization logic**Time Spent**: 1 hour#### Fixed Comment Persistence Between Videos**Activity**: Ensured comments persist when navigating between videos- **Problem**: Comments disappeared when returning to a video- **Solution**:  - Separated loading and synchronization into separate useEffects  - Ensured comments load immediately on assetId change  - Fixed race conditions in state updates**Time Spent**: 1 hour#### Fixed Comments Being Added to All Videos**Activity**: Resolved closure issue with stale assetId values- **Problem**: Comments added to all videos due to stale closure- **Solution**:  - Added `currentAssetIdRef` to store current assetId  - Updated all add/delete functions to use ref instead of closure  - Ensured correct assetId context in all operations**Time Spent**: 1.5 hours#### AssetId Normalization**Activity**: Standardized assetId handling across the application- Normalized `assetId` to string format for consistent localStorage keys- Added validation to ensure saving only to current video- Improved data consistency**Time Spent**: 30 min---## Afternoon Session (13:00-18:00)### 13:00 - Lunch Break**Time**: 30 min### 13:30-18:00 - Performance Optimization Session#### Console.log Removal and Debug Optimization**Activity**: Cleaned up production code- Wrapped all 28 console.log/warn/error statements in conditional checks- Used `if (process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development')` pattern- Removed console statements from production builds**Time Spent**: 30 min#### Video Loading Optimization**Activity**: Improved video loading performance- Changed `preload="auto"` to `preload="metadata"` for faster initial load- Created loading skeleton with shimmer animation- Replaced black screen with progressive loading indicator- Implemented progress tracking for video buffering**Time Spent**: 1 hour#### RecommendationCard Optimization**Activity**: Optimized recommendation card rendering- Wrapped component in `React.memo` with custom comparator- Added `IntersectionObserver` for lazy loading thumbnails- Implemented thumbnail caching in localStorage (24 hours TTL)- Reduced unnecessary re-renders**Time Spent**: 1 hour#### React Components Optimization**Activity**: Optimized multiple React components- Wrapped `DynamicCommentsLayer` in `React.memo`- Wrapped `DynamicReactionsLayer` in `React.memo`- Wrapped `SegmentList` in `React.memo`- Optimized `useEffect` and `useMemo` dependencies- Used `useCallback` for `handleSegmentClick`**Time Spent**: 1 hour#### useVideoColorAnalysis Optimization**Activity**: Memoized video color analysis hook- Memoized result to avoid creating new object on each render- Reduced unnecessary calculations**Time Spent**: 15 min#### Media Loading Optimization**Activity**: Enhanced media file loading- Added retry logic with exponential backoff (3 attempts)- Implemented timeout mechanism (30 seconds)- Added blob URL caching (30 minutes TTL)- Improved error handling and user feedback**Time Spent**: 1 hour#### Segments and Interactions Optimization**Activity**: Optimized data structure operations- Replaced `filter` (O(n)) with Map for O(1) lookup- Memoized `interactionsByTimeMap` for efficient filtering- Improved performance for large datasets**Time Spent**: 45 min#### Loading States and Error Boundaries**Activity**: Improved error responsive (`w-8 h-8 sm:w-10 sm:h-10`)- **Layout optimization**: Responsive flex and grid layouts (`flex-col lg:flex-row`, `grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-2`)- **Button optimization**: Hidden text on mobile, visible on larger screens (`hidden xs:inline`)- **Modal responsiveness**: Adaptive modals with proper spacing and layout- **Breadcrumbs**: Truncation for mobile devices (`truncate On December 2, 2025, I completed a critical system infrastructure migration for the company. I successfully reorganized the DEC_25 folder structure from a Talents-based system to a Department-based system, affecting all 20+ employees. The new structure organizes files by department (AI, Design, Dev, Video, HR, Sales, Lead Generation, Finance), then by employee, then by week and day - this makes file navigation much simpler for the entire team. In addition to the folder migration, I established the WISPR FLOW tracking system, which is a standardized methodology for employees to document their daily work. This system includes templates and guides for tracking tasks, time spent, effort levels, and blockers. The system consists of 7 comprehensive documents (templates, guides, quick references) totaling over 1000 lines of documentation. Two team members (Dana Bindiak from Lead Generation and Svyatoslav Podolsky from Video) have already been trained on this new system and can help other team members get started. I also updated and tested the n8n automation that tracks late employees. The automation compares Discord voice login times with CRM check-in times, runs every 4 hours starting at 11 AM, and automatically outputs results to Google Sheets. The system correctly identifies employees who are "ok" (logged in by 9:15 AM), "late" (logged in between 9:16 and 11:00 AM), or "absent" (not logged in by 11:00 AM), and automatically excludes Days Off from tracking. I audited all Claude AI and Gmail accounts and purchased one new Claude Pro account (remotemployees@gmail.com). This purchase was documented in three locations: the A.I. files, Accesses_25, and Expenses. However, I identified a critical blocker: the team currently has only 3-4 verified Claude accounts for 20+ employees, and we need to purchase 10-15 more accounts immediately (cost approximately $300) to allow the team to work efficiently. I also found and fixed several employee folder location errors (Polina Bagun from Design and Dmitry Marinenko from Dev had work stored in the wrong locations), and I created the missing Sales department folder structure. During this work, I created comprehensive documentation files: a daily notes file (nts.md - 215 lines), a rules and context document (rdm.md - 202 lines), and a task list with 22 identified work items (todo.md - 261 lines). All of these files are stored in English in the employee's Week_01/02/Notes folder. Total time invested: approximately 11 productive hours. Major tasks completed: folder structure migration (4.5 hours), employee folder setup (2.5 hours), automation configuration (1 hour), team training (1.5 hours), account management (2 hours). Work remaining: complete exchange rate entries (30 minutes), purchase additional Claude accounts (critical priority), fix folder location error, and populate missing employee folders. The system is now operational but requires immediate action on the Claude account purchase to avoid team productivity bottlenecks. All work is documented and ready for review.

responded, permanently)  4. **MEMORY**: Shows entire database with filters- SMM manager vacancy posted yesterday - received 10-15 responses already- Responded to all applications and proactively sent vacancy to potential candidates- Using new bookmarklet to avoid duplicates and spam- Building contact database gradually- Future possibility: bulk import contacts into new CRM system- **Call with developers**:  - Discussed vacancy updates  - Found issues in already updated vacancies  - Developers are working on automation: completing prompts and automating everything possible  - For now, we continue updating vacancies manually  - Need to see how updates look on the site to understand the format of edits- Responded to messages in Telegram- Sent follow-ups for the last 2 weeks## Follow-ups Needed- Continue building contact database- Monitor SMM manager vacancy responses- Consider CRM integration for bulk contact import when new CRM is ready- Continue updating vacancies manually- Check how updates look on the site after sending- Understand the format of edits based on how they appear on the site- Wait for developers to complete automation## Questions/Issues- Тотал 8

# Daily Activities - Day 02## Meeting Summary### Discussion Topics#### 1. Team Lead Participation in Client Calls- **Context**: Regarding interviews that were scheduled for recruiting (general confusion about scheduling)- **Issue**: Unexpected client appeared yesterday evening, call scheduled for this morning - no candidates available- **Solution Discussed**: Team Lead should join emergency client calls to:  - Demonstrate company professionalism  - Present company methodologies  - Explain that hired candidates will receive training/onboarding support  - Offer first days free for full onboarding- **Clarification**: This is NOT for every call, only emergency situations where:  - Client appeared last minute (yesterday → today)  - No candidates available  - Need to preserve client relationship  - Team Lead can best represent the department#### 2. Recruiting Department Situation- **Current State**:   - Only 2 people in recruiting department  - Anastasia just completed recruiting training  - Cannot spare resources for projects (part-time or quarter-time)  - Department has unlimited tasks- **Decision**: Cannot assign Anastasia to projects at this time - department needs all hands#### 3. Training System vs. Hiring External Recruiters- **New Approach**: Instead of hiring external recruiters, create a system to train any manager with English- **System Components Needed**:  - Message templates  - Lists (candidate pools)  - Follow-ups  - Recruiting stages/processes- **Concept**: Universal specialist pipeline (funnel approach)  - Wide entry gates - accept as many candidates as possible  - Advertise professions that get most responses  - Filter during general onboarding based on skills  - Route to appropriate departments after assessment#### 4. Onboarding #2 Development (December Task)- **Timeline**: December implementation (4-5 days)- **Structure**:   - Each department takes 2 days to create department-specific tasks  - Can create detailed tasks for own department  - Must provide instructions/rules for other departments- **Requirements**:  - Document creation needed  - Tasks must have supporting documents with details  - Tools must be marked/noted  - Personal calls needed:     - To show how to do it    - To check progress    - To verify implementation- **Reason**: New people won't understand from half-words - need full documentation#### 5. Presale Flow Systematization- **Goal**: Establish complete presale system (not just presale as a factor, but entire system)- **Weekly Flow Structure**:  - **Wednesday**: Client interviews (always on Wednesdays)  - **Thursday**: Know who/what is needed (±)  - **Thursday-Sunday**: Build candidate pool (all into one funnel, as many as possible)  - **Monday-Tuesday**: Verify and validate candidates will potentially stay on project  - **Next Wednesday**: Present candidates to client- **Documentation**: Everything must be documented in Dropbox:  - README files  - Full ecosystem description  - Week-to-week flow tracking  - Files, tracking, progress, WhisperFlow, etc.- **Phase 0 (December)**: Training phase  - Make as many mistakes as possible  - Understand what documents are missing  - Write missing documents  - Identify what didn't work  - Implement rules  - Refine process like clockwork#### 6. Final Goals- **Primary Goal**: 100 presales on website by January- **Blocking Factor**: Video interview processing  - Try to achieve 1-day turnaround for presale videos to be uploaded to website- **Target**: Meet new season in January with this system in place## Key Decisions Made1. **Team Lead joins emergency client calls** (not all calls, only emergencies)2. **Train managers in recruiting** instead of hiring external recruiters3. **Create universal specialist pipeline** system4. **Develop Onboarding #2** in December (each department creates 2-day tasks)5. **Systematize presale flow** with Wednesday client calls6. **Goal: 100 presales** on website by January## Action Items for Anastasia- [ ] Understand the training system approach for managers- [ ] Prepare to create Onboarding #2 tasks for recruiting department- [ ] Prepare instructions for other departments on how to create their Onboarding #2- [ ] Work on systematizing presale flow documentation- [ ] Support presale flow Phase 0 implementation in December

### **Daily Report****Key Result: The job site production cycle is fully completed, and the Google Maps project has entered the iterative refinement phase based on direct feedback from the team.**Today marked a significant milestone, marking the successful completion of one major project and the beginning of a new, qualitative phase in the development of another.**Key Achievements:**1. **The job site data processing project is fully completed:*** Processing of all remaining companies from the large dataset has been completed.* **The final, fully completed spreadsheet has been uploaded** and transferred to production. This multi-day production cycle has officially and successfully concluded.2. **Constructive working conference with end users was held:*** A **productive meeting was held with the lead generation department's leads**, dedicated to working with a spreadsheet from the Google Maps project.* Specific pain points were identified and invaluable feedback was received from the team, namely:* The presence of **irrelevant columns** that complicate work.* The inclusion of **irrelevant companies** in the final sample, wasting the team's time.3. **Immediately began work on improvements:*** Without delay, **immediately after the meeting, work began to correct** the identified deficiencies.* Active code refinement is already underway to remove unnecessary columns and implement stricter filtering logic to weed out irrelevant companies.**Results and next steps:**The day was extremely productive. One major project was completed. For the second, flagship project, a **team -> developer feedback loop** was successfully created and activated, which is key to creating a truly valuable and user-friendly tool.**The next step** is clearly defined: tomorrow we need to **finish the code refinement** and **launch a new scraping and analysis cycle** using the updated, smarter, and more efficient script.

Successfully established efficient template-based reporting system in collaboration with leadership, delivered all portrait materials for presale employee, created comprehensive department workflow documentation, and supported department-wide AI workflow training initiative. All activities aligned with strategic goals of improving efficiency while maintaining operational excellence.**Overall Rating**: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ Excellent Day---## Key Accomplishments### 1. Department: Design

Task Name: User & Admin Check-In Flow Improvements
Task Status: CompletedDescription of Work Done:
– Continued working on the Attendance & Access Control Module.

– Check-in now uses a single QR code scan.
– Check-out is now simplified to a single button tap to save attendance time.
